reviews.text: I had a terrible experience at the Inn at Keystone. First this hotel is not well located (virtually no restaurants or shops around). Second the rooms are really inconfortable (horrible mattresses and pillows, cheap furniture, etc.). Then comes the customer service, which is ...inexistent. The staff couldn't help me several times I needed assistance and if there is a problem they do everything they can to let you solve by yourself the problem. For example, the hotel claims that they provide free wireless internet access to every rooms but if you stay in a room in one of the corners of the hotel, then you can't get a sufficient signal and it is up to you (not to the hotel staff) to call the internet provider (which can takes more than 30 mins) to solve the problem.
reviews.title: Avoid this place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Inn for one night after sleeping in our truck for two days. I have to admit, we would have been happier spending another night in the truck rather than stay at the Inn. We paid over $300 for a room because it was during a holiday weekend. You would think at this price they would at least include breakfast. The room was decent, but the service was terrible. We called to ask how much it would be to stay another night and no one got back to us with an answer. The shower was terrible. I burned my head because of the fluctuation in temperature. The people at the desk were rude. Obviously, the Inn is making enough money to not be concerned about each individual guest. Unless you have more than enough money that you can just throw it away on bad service, I suggest you find somewhere else to stay.
reviews.title: Terrible service at outrageous prices
Just fine for skiing all day
reviews.text: This was our second time at the Inn. It was just fine for our purposes of skiing, then relaxing a couple of hours in the room. There are three outdoor hot tubs and the hotel bar is affordable and tasty. I didn't think the room was quite as good as last year but we only had minor issues. Housekeeping did not refill several of the lotion and soap dispensers and did not replace some of the glasses but we called and they were friendly and fixed the problem immediately. The front desk was helpful, too. We'd stay again for the price and friendly service. It's the cheapest option in the area without being scary.

This is my second year here. The value of the Inn is what brought me back, as well as the proximity to the slopes at Keystone. The room I upgraded to was a suite with a separate bedroom and two bathrooms. There is a fridge and coffee maker but there is no microwave, which would be nice to have. The hot tubs are nice after a day of hard skiing. Now for the "dings"...The slopes are more like 500 yards away, almost two foot ball fields and can be challenging in full gear. I now rent a locker for my shoes and carry my boots etc. There is a shuttle if you want to take it. Parking is a problem. We had to park across the street from the hotel; across a four lane boulevard that had no stop light and where cars whiz by at 45mph. There is no security for your automobile. There are a limited amount of spaces that are beneath/behind the hotel but there are not enough spaces to cover a weekday evening! Forget weekends. The restaurant is hit or miss. We have had very good food and service but somewhat inconsistent with service. Nice atmosphere in the restaurant and lobby. As far as returning to Keystone, we will see what else is out there in the future.
reviews.title: Convenient Inn...amost

reviews.text: My boyfriend and I have come back to Inn at Keystone for the second year in a row, and plan on coming back every year. The hotel is great. The hotel staff is very friendly, the lobby is very nice. There is a great lounge where you can get a killer martini or great seafood chowder. The room has beautiful views of the slopes and its about a 300 meter walk or you can take a shuttle from outside your door to the slopes. It is quiet, great roof top hot tubs. The price is GREAT. We are young professionals and travel a lot and really really love this hotel. It is exactly what you need if you are not a snob and are going for a great ski trip!!!!
reviews.title: little gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Inn has very hospitable staff, great location to the slopes, and convenient location regarding bus stop that takes you to River Run Village in less than 5 minutes. The bathrooms however were pretty disgusting at least in our room. The tub floor was grimy with black spots, the tile floor in the bathroom was a little dirty looking as well. Carpet in room looked like it could be replaced and bring your own pillow -so soft your head sinks through and wake up with kink in you neck. lastly, to adjust to the elevation you may find you need the humidifier. In pulling ours out of the closet we saw what looked like a melted filter but they replaced it with a new one within minutes of our request.
reviews.title: Overall Inn at Keystone pretty good

reviews.text: Stayed over MLK weekend. Originally booked a normal mountain view king room, but was upgraded for free to a king suite (not sure why, but we did not argue). The room was very clean and the heater worked very well. Included in the room was a humidifier along with a free standing fan. The water was incredibly hot and provided plenty of pressure for a great shower. The bed and the pull-out bed were both comfortable. The front desk was very friendly and polite and tried to help as best as they could. We ate breakfast in the downstairs restaurant and while it was good, it was a bit expensive for a small buffet ($11/person). The walk from the Inn to the lifts is not as long as some previous reviewers have stated. It takes about 5-10mins max, and if anything, helps you get your legs warmed up and ready to go for the day. There is also a complimentary shuttle that takes you in and around the Keystone resort. Overall, I would definitely come back here again in the winter and summer, even if they do not randomly upgrade me for free...
reviews.title: They made a repeat customer out of me.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was perfect for us. Great location near skiing, restaurants, ski gear rental, etc. Nice room, nice service. We had a great experience. The only hang-up was parking. They have VERY limited parking, but will valet park your car for free. Nice, but sometimes it might be a pain to have to get Valet to get your car every time you need to travel. Otherwise a GREAT experience. We WOULD stay there again.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would definitely recommend this hotel, especially if you are bringing along your furry family members! We stayed at the Inn over Christmas 2007 and had a really great time!! The main reason we selected Inn at Keystone was because they are "pet-friendly"….. and they really are!! We took our two English Bulldogs and there were many other playmates for the girls! The staff is friendly, but not overly intelligent, so be patient. The restaurant has "okay" food, had to wait for the breakfast buffet on more than one occasion to be restocked. Room service was prompt, but food, again, just okay. Try the steakhouse at Keystone Lodge....Yum-o! The view from our room was spectacular!!!....to say the least! The room was clean and well stocked with amenities, which is a good thing when you are with pets because your room does not get room service unless your pets are not in the room. Totally understand the policy, but we had our dogs crated and they still would not service the room. They did, however, provide clean towels and coffee every day. The lifts are a short walk (without ski boots!) and Dercum Mountain is beautiful! They have certain floors designated for pets, so no worries if you are not bringing pets, just be aware that they are in the hotel, lobby, parking lots, etc.!
reviews.title: Pet Friendly For Sure!

likes.disliked: — Really wanted to stay in a Suite, but not availabe to pet owners

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Most unhelpful staff I've ever encountered. Checked in and in the evening tried to take a shower. No hot water. Called down to the front desk and was told I was the only one this complaint there was nothing they could. I told them that was unacceptable, we wanted access to a room with hot water and they told me I could come down and shower where the staff does. I told them for $150+ a night I did not think that was an acceptable solution. After several calls, nothing was resolved. They sounded more like stoned teens than adults being paid to assit guests. They refused to check other rooms to see if the problem was more widespread, they refuse access to an additional room with a shower so we could check, they refused refund. It went unresolved for the evening. The next morning I was in the elevator with a repair man who said the hot water heater had gone out and the entire hotel was out of hot water. They were not notified until morning when additional customers called to complain, which means the entire hotel was inconvienced, rather than resolving it the night before. We requested a discount since you stay at a hotel to shower & sleep and we were not able to shower, and the repeatable phones from the staff just to annoy us hindered our sleep. Nothing, told they need to speak to their manager (a repeatable excuse with every request for access to room with a hot water). I later emailed the Inn at Keystone with a step-by-step of their incompetence and inconvience they caused us. I received absolutely no reply. DO NOT STAY HERE. I have never been more frustrated with customer service than here.
reviews.title: Never again-- the front desk & managment could not be more unhelpful

reviews.text: If you don't want to pay the prices that come with staying in the heart of River Run Village, this location is a good alternative. It is a short walk to the lifts in the Mountain House base area, is located in between 2 fun bars/restaurants, The Goat and the Snake River Saloon, and the rooms were basic, but clean and comfortable.
reviews.title: Great access to slopes

likes.liked: — Central location, easy walk to the lifts and bars

reviews.text: Parking is limited. Overall, a solid, trustworthy choice.
reviews.title: Excellent Inn

reviews.text: Our friend works in town and scheduled this place for me and my wife. The room and view were excellent. Front desk courteous and helpful. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Better than expected
Grander than it sounds...
reviews.text: I stayed at the Inn for two nights in late March. The room was nice looking, large and had a great view of the mountain. The hot tubs were nice and not crowded. The bed was a bit hard and the pillows not great, but it was quiet so I slept well. Overall, it was better than the reviews on this site led me to believe. The walk to the lift is long though, so it's not exactly ski in/ski out.

reviews.title: Overall good experience.
reviews.text: We booked two nights at the Inn at Keystone for about $80/night through Priceline--I wasn't sure what to expect because of some of the mixed reviews this property had been getting.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We made our reservation with The Inn due to its proximity to a wedding that we were attending as well as its value. Sometimes, its worth paying the extra money. We had to call the front desk 3 times for the location because they would not offer adequate directions. This wasn't complicated to get to, but the staff were very put out and not accomadating. They would not mention once we made the turn off the highway to drive down a short side street a few blocks. They insisted it was right off the turn and it is very apparent it is not (there is a restaurant and an entirely different hotel on the corner of Highway 6 and Razor). You have to go around a bend a few blocks to the hotel that you cannot see from the corner.
reviews.title: Miserable staff, Poor Accomadations...Nice Views Though!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in is at 4pm. Never heard of a check in this late, but oh well. I can understand if this were during a busy season or if the hotel was fully booked, but it wasn't at all (in fact, quite quiet and empty). We were unable to check into our room any earlier and were forced to get ready for the wedding in our car in the parking lot. The check in info is not posted anywhere on our reservation or website - so beware.
reviews.title: Good Value and comfortable

reviews.text: The room was miserably hot (not too common in the mountains, even in the summer). There is no AC in the rooms, but in there is plenty in the hallways (???). Suggestion is to splurge the extra money and stay with a nicer resort.
reviews.title: Fine as a base for skiing/boarding

likes.liked: — Fairly close to slopes with bus service to other areas

reviews.title: Parking Situation a Disaster
reviews.text: The Keystone Inn is a clean and comfortable place. Because they are associated with the Keystone Lodge (which is a step up) you are able to take advantage of the other hotel's facilities. The staff was very helpful and really seemed to go out of their way to make you feel valued. Overall - great experience.

That said, the hotel bar made much to be desired in the area of customer service. They had recently updated the prices to their drinks, yet due to printing issues with the menu, they still posted their old prices. When the bill came, they charged me the new amount and passed it on as no big deal. When confronting the bar shift manager, she had a little attitude and still charged us the higher amount. Needless to say, the issue was resolved --- but I have no plans of having a drink in the lobby again.
reviews.title: Not bad, but not the best

likes.liked: — The extremely helpful manager, the proximity to everything
